attributes.action: Oppose the closure of North Yorkshire's Post Offices
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Post Office announced its proposal to close five local branches: Fylingthorpe, Helredale, Ruswarp, Sandsend and Westcliff.

This attack on rural services will:

1) seriously affect the lives of people in these communities, especially the elderly, infirm and disabled.

2) There will be a knock-on effect on other sevices, especially village shops which are the lifeblood of many communites.

3) It would mean extra car/bus journeys to alternate branches, which would increase the carbon emissions within the North York Moors National Park.

4) It would inconvenience tourists, a major part of the local economy.
